name: Mac OS X Safari file:// Redirection Sandbox Escape
author: joev <joev@metasploit.com>
description:
Versions of Safari before 8.0.6, 7.1.6, and 6.2.6 are vulnerable to a
        "state management issue" that allows a browser window to be navigated
        to a file:// URL. By dropping and loading a malicious .webarchive file,
        an attacker can read arbitrary files, inject cross-domain Javascript, and
        silently install Safari extensions.

options.name: WORKSPACE
options.description: Specify the workspace for this module

options.name: VERBOSE
options.description: Enable detailed status messages

options.name: SRVHOST
options.description: The local host or network interface to listen on. This must be an address on the local machine or 0.0.0.0 to listen on all addresses.

options.name: SRVPORT
options.description: The local port to use for the FTP server

options.name: ListenerComm
options.description: The specific communication channel to use for this service

options.name: SSL
options.description: Negotiate SSL for incoming connections

options.name: SSLCert
options.description: Path to a custom SSL certificate (default is randomly generated)

options.name: SSLCompression
options.description: Enable SSL/TLS-level compression

options.name: SSLCipher
options.description: String for SSL cipher spec - "DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA" or "ADH"

options.name: TCP::max_send_size
options.description: Maximum tcp segment size.  (0 = disable)

options.name: TCP::send_delay
options.description: Delays inserted before every send.  (0 = disable)

options.name: PASVPORT
options.description: The local PASV data port to listen on (0 is random)

options.name: URIPATH
options.description: The URI to use for this exploit (default is random)

options.name: FILENAME
options.description: The file name

options.name: GRABPATH
options.description: The URI to receive the UXSS'ed data

options.name: DOWNLOAD_PATH
options.description: The path to download the webarchive

options.name: FILE_URLS
options.description: Additional file:// URLs to steal. $USER will be resolved to the username.

options.name: STEAL_COOKIES
options.description: Enable cookie stealing

options.name: STEAL_FILES
options.description: Enable local file stealing

options.name: INSTALL_EXTENSION
options.description: Silently install a Safari extensions (requires click)

options.name: EXTENSION_URL
options.description: HTTP URL of a Safari extension to install

options.name: EXTENSION_ID
options.description: The ID of the Safari extension to install

options.name: HTTPPORT
options.description: The HTTP server port
